robot_capabilities.humanoidAlpha: Humanoid robot with articulated arms and posture control. Can lift one side of the stretcher and maintain synchronized gait with a partner robot. It can carry the human safely and put them on stretcher.
robot_capabilities.humanoidBeta: Humanoid robot with balanced bipedal locomotion and strength-matched arms. Can mirror partner movements and ensure even lifting and walking while carrying loads. It can carry the human safely and put them on stretcher.

robot_morphology.humanoidAlpha: Height: 1.6 m, Arm Payload: 35 kg, Weight: 80 kg, Arm Reach: 700 mm, Gait: Adaptive, Gripper: Human-handle compatible
robot_morphology.humanoidBeta: Height: 1.6 m, Arm Payload: 35 kg, Weight: 80 kg, Arm Reach: 700 mm, Gait: Adaptive, Gripper: Human-handle compatible

task_specific_rules: An average stretcher weighs around 5 kg and is 2000 mm long.
An average victim weighs around 70 kg and is 1800 mm long.
A stretcher can be lifted by two humanoid robots, each lifting one end.
Humanoid robots must maintain synchronized movement to avoid dropping the stretcher.
